description.narrative: Projektet syftar till att stärka den Guatemalas statistikmyndighets (INE) kapacitet att genomföra stitt uppdrag och därmed förbättra tillgången på statistik i landet. Det handlar om att förbättra kvaliteten i den statistik som INE själv producerar, särkilt inom områdena ekonomi, miljö och jämställdhet. Det handlar också om att stärka myndighetens förmåga att samordna Gutamalas nationella statistiksystem och bidra till kvalitetssäkring av statistik som levereras av andra myndigheter. Projektet förväntas bidra till ökad transparens i samhället och till att företag, politiker och privatpersoner har bättre underlag för sina beslut. Insatsen genomförs av Statistiska Centralbyrån, som i sin tur ger stöd till INE.

The aim of the intervention is to strengthen the capacity of Guatemala's national statistics agency to: (i) coordinate and lead the national statistics system; and (ii) produce high quality statistics. The project is expected to contribute better economic, environmental and gender statistics, incrementing the trust in statistics as a basis for decision making among actors in society. The project will be implemented by Statistic Sweden, which will provide technical and capacity development support to its Guatemalan counterpart.

The overall objective pursued through the implementation of the proposed cooperation project is that Guatemala counts on statistical data that are reliable, impartial and of good quality for the decision making by the government, the state and private sector as well as for civil society, including for research and debate. The project will more specifically support the strategic orientations regarding the following priority areas: this includes strengthening INE’s ability to coordinate the Guatemalan statistical system, strengthening INE’s capacity in coordinating users and producers of statistics (Oficinas Sectorales de Estadistica, OSCE). Furthermore, the project aims to increase the credibility of the statistics produced and to increase the dissemination of statistical data.

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

17.18 - By 2020, enhance capacity-building support to developing countries, including for least developed countries and small island developing States, to increase significantly the availability of high-quality, timely and reliable data disaggregated by income, gender, age, race, ethnicity, migratory status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts

17.18 - By 2020, enhance capacity-building support to developing countries, including for least developed countries and small island developing States, to increase significantly the availability of high-quality, timely and reliable data disaggregated by income, gender, age, race, ethnicity, migratory status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts.

17.19 - By 2030, build on existing initiatives to develop measurements of progress on sustainable development that complement gross domestic product, and support statistical capacity-building in developing countries

17.19 - By 2030, build on existing initiatives to develop measurements of progress on sustainable development that complement gross domestic product, and support statistical capacity-building in developing countries.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: There have been some deviations in project implementation since project start in 2016. Areas such as environmental- and climate statistics, gender statistics and improved management structures have not been sufficiently resourced within the institute and the leadership at INE needed to prioritise the population census carried out in 2019 which inevitably have had consequences for the project. Presidential elections were held in 2019 and this created some uncertainty among INE staff since changes in government and leadership may affect individual staff at the institution in terms of keeping their positions. INE staff and leadership are showing a great commitment to the project and participate in trainings led by the short-term consultants from SCB. Results such as the booklet on “Women and men in Guatemala” and strengthened capacity in economic statistics and statistical methods are positive. The lack of knowledge of statistical methodology is one of the most limiting factors for INE as well as the national statistical system in general. The project has therefore strengthened this area both at INE staff and in the national statistical system. The component for environmental and climate statistics has been particularly difficult to implement. SCB is looking into how this can be improved in a continued project from 2021 and onwards. Highlights in results: - In the price statistics component important progress has been made with the Producer Price Index (PPI) with the implementation of methodology in compliance with international standards. Also, training in index theory has increased the competence level of INE staff. - In the gender statistics component, INE finished the production and the graphic design of the booklet “Women and men in Guatemala”. The booklet is yet to be published as INE decided to add updated figures using the population census data and proceed with publication during 2020. - Related to the information technology and the communication components, INE made some progress with the implementation of an intranet, although it is yet not fully implemented. - In the component for strenthening of management theres has been an improved use of vertical communication and in INE's managerial follow-up system. INE has now a functional management group that conducts regular meetings for planning and monitoring. - The results in the component in information technology was slowed down due to the census work since many staff were re-directed to work with the census and could not particpate in activities with SCB nor implement agreed improvements. Despite this there have been improvements in the IT infrastructure and security during the last years. - Environmental statistics keep being a difficult area to implement and it has been agreed with INE that in this particular area it should be a focus on environmental statistics related to measuring progress of the sustainable development goals (SDG's). There are no significant achievements yet in this area, during 2018 SCB supported some meetings with the topic Agenda 2030 but not specifically focused on environment.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
